data.title: Govinda on fallout with David Dhawan: 'He said I've started asking too many questions, asked me to do small roles'
data.meta_description: The director and actor have collaborated for 18 films from 1989 to 2009, 'Do Knot Disturb' being their last film together
data.text:
Right from Taqatwar in 1989 to Do Knot Disturb in 2009, actor Govinda and director David Dhawan collaborated for 18 films together. But there came a time when they stopped working together after an apparent fallout. What went wrong between them?

Back in 2018, when the actor was on the show Aap Ki Adalat, he revealed, âWhen I completed 17 films with him, I told him the subject of Chashme Baddoor and he started the film with Rishi Kapoor. And when he was shooting the film, I called him and he said, ‘Tu sun toh mein kaise film bana raha hoon.Then I said, ‘Tu mujhe kehta toh - subject bhi utha lia.â

Advertisement

He added, âAfter I left politics, I told my secretary to keep the phone speaker on, so that I could listen to what he (David Dhawan ) was saying. I heard David saying, ‘Chi-Chi (Govinda’s nickname) is questioning a lot.’ He was telling my secretary, ‘I do not want to work with Govinda anymore. Tell him to do some small bit roles.’ This shocked me and I decided never to work with him. After 4-5 months, I again rang him up just to find out if he would give me a guest appearance in his film. He then never rang me back. I am revealing this in public after so many years. I think he is under somebody’s influence. I do not think he is that same David Dhawan who I used to know.â

A possible reunion?

Speaking to the Bombay Times, Govinda said, “I am glad people still feel that we should work together. _Yeh unka pyaar ha_i. (This is there love) our patch-up had already happened. This was our second meeting. It was a Diwali bash where we ate good food and had a great time. We donât believe in raking up the past. Why mull over it? Thatâs not necessary. Let bygones be bygones. Filmy talk wasnât a priority, but when that happened, we only spoke about the happy memories and those were plenty.”

Advertisement

They both met at Ramesh Tauraniâs Diwali party.
